results.title: The Silence of the Lambs
results.brief_description: Jonathan Demme’s adaptation of Thomas Harris’ Silence of the Lambs set the standard for modern serial killer movies. Stellar performances and iconic characters helped it take out five Academy Awards and has been described as the Psycho of the 90s.

constellations_other.name: Splicing history and silencing the lambs
constellations_other.description: With plastic strips coated with light-sensitive emulsions, film strips captured light and created moving pictures. In this Constellation we trace celluloid and splicing as plot device to serial killers, secrets agents and Super 8.

results.description: Clarice Starling is a top student at the FBI’s training academy. Jack Crawford wants Clarice to interview Dr. Hannibal Lecter, a brilliant psychiatrist who is also a violent psychopath, serving life behind bars for various acts of murder and cannibalism. Crawford believes that Lecter may have insight into a case and that Starling, as an attractive young woman, may be just the bait to draw him out.
description_for_label: Clarice Starling is a top student at the FBI’s training academy. Jack Crawford wants Clarice to interview Dr. Hannibal Lecter, a brilliant psychiatrist who is also a violent psychopath, serving life behind bars for various acts of murder and cannibalism. Crawford believes that Lecter may have insight into a case and that Starling, as an attractive young woman, may be just the bait to draw him out.

results.title: The Show Must Go On
results.brief_description: During a reality show a war starts, but the producer will do anything to hide it from the contestants.
results.description: During a reality show a war starts, but the producer will do anything to hide it from the contestants.
description_for_label: During a reality show a war starts, but the producer will do anything to hide it from the contestants.

results.title: The Shining
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1980
results.brief_description: Jack Torrance accepts a caretaker job at the Overlook Hotel, where he, along with his wife Wendy and their son Danny, must live isolated from the rest of the world for the winter. But they aren’t prepared for the madness that lurks within.

constellations_other.name: 9.5mm Pathe-Baby and parents behaving badly
constellations_other.description: A look at the link between the Pathé-Baby system and animation, as well as the relationship between cinematic parents and their children.

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi miniatures
constellations_other.description: As filmmaking technologies have changed and evolved over the decades, much like audiences, miniatures have endured as one of the most effective film special effects.

constellations_other.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

constellations_other.name: Blood, shot
constellations_other.description: The fake blood used by costume designer Edie Kurzer in Judy & Punch is connected to a long, bloody lineage in cinema.

results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1980
results.description: Jack Torrance accepts a caretaker job at the Overlook Hotel, where he, along with his wife Wendy and their son Danny, must live isolated from the rest of the world for the winter. But they aren’t prepared for the madness that lurks within.
description_for_label: Jack Torrance accepts a caretaker job at the Overlook Hotel, where he, along with his wife Wendy and their son Danny, must live isolated from the rest of the world for the winter. But they aren’t prepared for the madness that lurks within.

results.title: The Shape of Water
results.brief_description: An other-worldly story, set against the backdrop of Cold War era America circa 1962, where a mute janitor working at a lab falls in love with an amphibious man being held captive there and devises a plan to help him escape.

constellations_other.name: Sweet Country
constellations_other.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

results.description: An other-worldly story, set against the backdrop of Cold War era America circa 1962, where a mute janitor working at a lab falls in love with an amphibious man being held captive there and devises a plan to help him escape.
description_for_label: An other-worldly story, set against the backdrop of Cold War era America circa 1962, where a mute janitor working at a lab falls in love with an amphibious man being held captive there and devises a plan to help him escape.

results.title: The Secret of NIMH
results.brief_description: A widowed field mouse must move her family — including an ailing son — to escape a farmer’s plow. Aided by a crow and a pack of superintelligent, escaped lab rats, the brave mother struggles to transplant her home to firmer ground.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

results.description: A widowed field mouse must move her family — including an ailing son — to escape a farmer’s plow. Aided by a crow and a pack of superintelligent, escaped lab rats, the brave mother struggles to transplant her home to firmer ground.
description_for_label: A widowed field mouse must move her family — including an ailing son — to escape a farmer’s plow. Aided by a crow and a pack of superintelligent, escaped lab rats, the brave mother struggles to transplant her home to firmer ground.

results.title: The Secret Life of Us
results.brief_description: The Secret Life of Us is an Australian television drama series about the lives of 20-30 somethings living in the early 2000s.

constellations_other.name: 2000s TV
constellations_other.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

constellations_other.name: The secret life of suburbia and music videos
constellations_other.description: Australia's famous streets and suburbs have defined music videos, TV shows and miniseries, providing a unique backdrop to Australian stories and music.

constellations_other.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_other.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

results.description: The Secret Life of Us is an Australian television drama series about the lives of 20-30 somethings living in the early 2000s.
description_for_label: The Secret Life of Us is an Australian television drama series about the lives of 20-30 somethings living in the early 2000s.

results.title: The Science of Sleep
results.brief_description: A man entranced by his dreams and imagination is lovestruck with a French woman and feels he can show her his world.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion fantasies
constellations_other.description: The LEGO Movie draws on fan-made stop-motion films for its aesthetic style, but fantastical animation comes in many forms.

results.description: A man entranced by his dreams and imagination is lovestruck with a French woman and feels he can show her his world.
description_for_label: A man entranced by his dreams and imagination is lovestruck with a French woman and feels he can show her his world.

results.title: The Sapphires
results.creator_credit: Wayne Blair, Tony Briggs, Keith Thompson, Rosemary Blight, Melinda Doring, Gordon Westman, Goalpost Pictures and Kylie du Fresne
results.brief_description: It’s 1968, and four young, talented Australian Aboriginal girls learn about love, friendship and war when they entertain the US troops in Vietnam as singing group The Sapphires.

constellations_other.name: Setting the record straight
constellations_other.description: For too long, the history of Australia was only told in mainstream films through a white lens. First Nations people have used the camera as a means of truth-telling and setting the record straight for decades.

constellations_other.name: Sequins and sapphires
constellations_other.description: Two of the most striking costumes on the big and small screens embody the glamour of leading First Peoples ladies.

constellations_other.name: Rachel Perkins
constellations_other.description: The moving image has helped tell First Peoples stories through documentary, films and TV shows, with acclaimed director, producer and screenwriter Rachel Perkins contributing significantly to these stories.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Wayne Blair, Tony Briggs, Keith Thompson, Rosemary Blight, Melinda Doring, Gordon Westman, Goalpost Pictures and Kylie du Fresne
results.description: It’s 1968, and four young, talented Australian Aboriginal girls learn about love, friendship and war when they entertain the US troops in Vietnam as singing group The Sapphires.
description_for_label: It’s 1968, and four young, talented Australian Aboriginal girls learn about love, friendship and war when they entertain the US troops in Vietnam as singing group The Sapphires.

results.title: The Road
results.creator_credit: John Hillcoat, Margot Wilson, Joe Penhall, Steve Schwartz, Paula Mae Schwartz, Chris Kennedy, Nick Wechsler, Chockstone Pictures, Nick Wechsler Productions, 2929 Productions and Dimension Films
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Cormac McCarthy’s bleak apocalyptic novel starring Viggo Mortensen, Australian actor Kodi Smit-McPhee and Charlise Theron.

constellations_other.name: Outlaws and the end
constellations_other.description: Tracing connections from Sweet Country to Australian westerns and resistance to white colonial narratives.

results.creator_credit_for_label: John Hillcoat, Margot Wilson, Joe Penhall, Steve Schwartz, Paula Mae Schwartz, Chris Kennedy, Nick Wechsler, Chockstone Pictures, Nick Wechsler Productions, 2929 Productions and Dimension Films
results.description: A father and his son walk alone through burned America. Nothing moves in the ravaged landscape save the ash on the wind and water. It is cold enough to crack stones, and, when the snow falls it is gray. The sky is dark. Their destination is the warmer south, although they don’t know what, if anything, awaits them there.
description_for_label: A father and his son walk alone through burned America. Nothing moves in the ravaged landscape save the ash on the wind and water. It is cold enough to crack stones, and, when the snow falls it is gray. The sky is dark. Their destination is the warmer south, although they don’t know what, if anything, awaits them there.

results.title: The Revenant
results.headline_credit: Canada, Hong Kong, Taiwan and United States of America, 2015
results.brief_description: In the 1820s, a frontiersman, Hugh Glass, sets out on a path of vengeance against those who left him for dead after a bear mauling.

constellations_other.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_other.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

results.headline_credit_for_label: Canada, Hong Kong, Taiwan and United States of America, 2015
results.description: In the 1820s, a frontiersman, Hugh Glass, sets out on a path of vengeance against those who left him for dead after a bear mauling.

creators_other.name: Hong Kong Alpha Motion Pictures Co.
